member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.Cameras.StereoscopicCamera
member.summary: StereoscopicCamera is a camera that warps another camera () and provides properties that allow using the camera for stereoscopic rendering with different camera for left and for right eye. The current eye is defined by property. The differences of the left and right cameras are defined by , and properties.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Cameras.StereoscopicCamera.OriginalCamera
member.summary: Gets the camera that is used to create the StereoscopicCamera. The original camera is located in the middle between left and right eye.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Cameras.StereoscopicCamera.ParentDXScene
member.summary: Gets or sets a ParentDXScene property of the OriginalCamera.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Cameras.StereoscopicCamera.ParentSceneNode
member.summary: Gets a ParentSceneNode property of the OriginalCamera.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Cameras.StereoscopicCamera.ProjectionType
member.summary: Gets a ProjectionType property of the OriginalCamera.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Cameras.StereoscopicCamera.AspectRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets an AspectRatio property of the OriginalCamera.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Cameras.StereoscopicCamera.NearPlaneDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets a NearPlaneDistance property of the OriginalCamera.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Cameras.StereoscopicCamera.FarPlaneDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets a FarPlaneDistance property of the OriginalCamera.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Cameras.StereoscopicCamera.View
member.summary: Gets a View matrix for the current eye.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Cameras.StereoscopicCamera.Projection
member.summary: Gets a Projection matrix for the current eye.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Cameras.StereoscopicCamera.CurrentEye
member.summary: Gets or sets the current eye for the camera.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Cameras.StereoscopicCamera.EyeSeparation
member.summary: Gets or sets a distance between left and right eye. The distance is specified in the same coordinate system as the camera. When rendering, the camera is first shifter to the left for the half of the EyeSeparation distance. Then the whole scene is rendered. The the camera is shifter to the right for half of the EyeSeparation distance. The best value for EyeSeparation is based on the size of objects in the scene, the size of the Viewport3D, monitor DPI settings and the actual distance between eyes of the user.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Cameras.StereoscopicCamera.Parallax
member.summary: Parallax defines a value in degrees that specifies an angle of the left and right eye look direction. If the parallax is zero, then the look directions of left and right cameras are parallel. If parallax is bigger then zero, then the left and right look directions are pointed to each other and they cross at some position in front of the camera (the bigger the angle the closer the crossing point). Usually the best 3D effect is producted when the parallax is set so that the look directions cross at the center of the scene - look directions of human eyes cross at the point of focus.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Cameras.StereoscopicCamera.InvertLeftRightView
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean that specifies if positions of the eyes are inverted.

member.summary: CameraChanged event of the OriginalCamera.

member.summary: Constructor
member.param: camera that is wrapped by this StereoscopicCamera

member.returns: WorldViewProjection matrix

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.RenderingQueueSortingCompletedEventHandler
member.summary: RenderingQueueSortingCompletedEventHandler is an event handler with event.

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.RenderingQueueSortingCompletedEventArgs
member.summary: RenderingQueueSortingCompletedEventArgs is used for the event. The event is called after the RenderingQueue is sorted. It allows the code in the event handler to change the order in which objects are rendered by changing the values in the array (note: use RenderablePrimitives.Count to get number of items because SortedIndexes.Length may be to big).

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.RenderingQueueSortingCompletedEventArgs.RenderablePrimitives
member.summary: Gets a list of RenderablePrimitive objects that are defined in the sorted RenderingQueue.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.RenderingQueueSortingCompletedEventArgs.SortedIndexes
member.summary: Gets an array of indexes that define the sorted order of the RenderablePrimitives. To provide custom sort order the event handler may change the indexes in this array. IMPORTANT: Never use SortedIndexes.Length - this array may be bigger then required. To get count of items always use RenderablePrimitives.Count.

member.name: M:Ab3d.DirectX.RenderingQueueSortingCompletedEventArgs.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{Ab3d.DirectX.RenderablePrimitive},System.Int32[])
member.summary: Constructor
member.param: array of indexes that define the sorted order

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.ShaderQuality
member.summary: ShaderQuality enum specifies possible values for shader quality that define what kind of shaders should be used to render the scene.

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.ShaderQuality.Undefined
member.summary: Shader quality is not defined (usually used in Material when the PreferedShaderQuality is not set).

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.ShaderQuality.Low
member.summary: Low quality shaders are used - usually per vertex lighting is used. This shader quality setting has the best performance (hightes frames per second) but the lowest image quality.

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.ShaderQuality.Normal
member.summary: Normal quality shaders are used - usually per pixel lighting is used.

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.ShaderQuality.High
member.summary: High quality shaders are used. Note: DXEngine does not contain any high quality shaders. This means that when using shaders that come with DXEnige the results are the same as for Normal quality shader (but this setting can be used when custom shaders are used).

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.SupersamplingResolveFilterType
member.summary: SupersamplingResolveFilterType enum defines possible filtering types that are used to down-sample a super-sampled texture.

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.SupersamplingResolveFilterType.None
member.summary: Performs simple bilinear read from 2x2 pixels is used - no custom filter is used.

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.SupersamplingResolveFilterType.SquareFilterSize5
member.summary: Performs 5 bilinear reads per destination pixel in a rotated grid fashion and a center pixel with increased weight. The area of read texels is 2 x 2 texels around the center texel. To use this filer with 4x4 down-sampling, set the TexelOffsetsScale to 2.

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.SupersamplingResolveFilterType.RotatedFilterSize5
member.summary: Performs 5 bilinear reads per destination pixel in a rotated grid fashion and a center pixel with increased weight. The area of read texels is slightly bigger then 2 x 2 texels around the center texel. The result is smoother but slightly blurrier and in case of 3D lines slightly thicker lines.

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.SupersamplingResolveFilterType.RotatedFilterSize9
member.summary: Performs 9 bilinear reads per destination pixel in a rotated grid fashion and a center pixel with increased weight. The area of read texels is slightly bigger then 4 x 4 texels around the center texel. The result is smoother but slightly blurrier and in case of 3D lines slightly thicker lines.

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.TextureFilteringTypes
member.summary: TextureFilteringTypes enum defines the common Texture filtering types.

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.TextureFilteringTypes.Point
member.summary: Uses the color of the nearest neighboring pixel (produces square pixels when zoomed in).

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.TextureFilteringTypes.Bilinear
member.summary: Uses the color that is linearly interpolated from the nearest colors from the texture.

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.TextureFilteringTypes.Trilinear
member.summary: Uses the color that is linearly interpolated from the nearest colors from the two nearest mip map textures.

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.TextureFilteringTypes.Anisotropic_x2
member.summary: Anisotropic filtering with level 2 (compared to linear interpolation Anisotropic filtering improves details when camera angle is low).

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.TextureFilteringTypes.Anisotropic_x4
member.summary: Anisotropic filtering with level 4 (compared to linear interpolation Anisotropic filtering improves details when camera angle is low).

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.TextureFilteringTypes.Anisotropic_x8
member.summary: Anisotropic filtering with level 8 (compared to linear interpolation Anisotropic filtering improves details when camera angle is low).

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.TextureFilteringTypes.Anisotropic_x16
member.summary: Anisotropic filtering with level 16 (compared to linear interpolation Anisotropic filtering improves details when camera angle is low).

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.TextureInfo
member.summary: TextureInfo defines some properties of the texture.

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.TextureInfo.Width
member.summary: Width in pixels

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.TextureInfo.Height
member.summary: Height in pixels

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.TextureInfo.DpiX
member.summary: Dpi resolution in X direction. This value may not be set for some images (for example DDS images). In this case the value double.NaN.

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.TextureInfo.DpiY
member.summary: Dpi resolution in Y direction. This value may not be set for some images (for example DDS images). In this case the value double.NaN.

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.TextureInfo.Format
member.summary: DXGI image format

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.TextureInfo.HasTransparency
member.summary: True when the texture has transparent pixels. When using then standard image files (all except DDS) are by default checked for transparent pixels. In this case this property is true if the image actually contains transparent pixels. For DDS file or when transparency check is disabled in TextureLoader, then this property assumes presence of transparent pixels based on the image format.

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.TextureInfo.HasPremultipliedAlpha
member.summary: True if the bitmap is using a pre-multiplied alpha colors (rgb colors are multiplied by the alpha - for example a 50% transparent red color is: r=0.5, b=0, g=0, a=0.5). Usually this value is determined by the DGI format, except with DDS textures where the format defines the texture compression (DDS format) and does not specify if the colors are pre-multiplied by alpha.

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.PhysicallyBasedRenderingEffect
member.summary: PhysicallyBasedRenderingEffect is an effect that can render materials defined with physically based rendering properties - e.g. base color, metalness, roughness, emissive map, normal map and ambient occlusion textures.

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.PhysicallyBasedRenderingEffect.EffectName
member.summary: Effect name

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.PhysicallyBasedRenderingEffect.ShadowThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets a float value that helps prevent light bleeding (having areas that should be in shadow fully illuminated) for variance shadow mapping.

remarks.para: Gets or sets a float value that helps prevent light bleeding (having areas that should be in shadow fully illuminated) for variance shadow mapping.
The value is used to map all shadow values from 0 ... ShadowThreshold to 0 and then linearly rescale the values from ShadowThreshold to 1 into 0 to 1.
For more info see "Shadow bleeding" in "Chapter 8. Summed-Area Variance Shadow Maps" (https://developer.nvidia.com/gpugems/GPUGems3/gpugems3_ch08.html)

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.PhysicallyBasedRenderingEffect.ShadowTreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets a float value that helps prevent light bleeding (having areas that should be in shadow fully illuminated) for variance shadow mapping.

remarks.para: Gets or sets a float value that helps prevent light bleeding (having areas that should be in shadow fully illuminated) for variance shadow mapping.
The value is used to map all shadow values from 0 ... ShadowThreshold to 0 and then linearly rescale the values from ShadowThreshold to 1 into 0 to 1.
For more info see "Shadow bleeding" in "Chapter 8. Summed-Area Variance Shadow Maps" (https://developer.nvidia.com/gpugems/GPUGems3/gpugems3_ch08.html)

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.PhysicallyBasedRenderingEffect.ShadowDepthBias
member.summary: Gets or sets a float value that offsets the depth of the lights (distance from the lights to the object) and can help reduce the show artifacts in the corners. The value that works best need to be set based on the size of the scene. Default value is 0 that does not apply any bias.

member.name: M:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.PhysicallyBasedRenderingEffect.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.PhysicallyBasedRenderingEffect.SetShadowMappingParameters(Ab3d.DirectX.ShadowLightData[],Ab3d.DirectX.RenderingContext)
member.summary: SetShadowMappingParameters sets parameters needed for shadow mapping.
member.param: array of ShadowLightData - one element for each light

member.summary: Sets per frame settings for this effect (this sets camera, lights and other per frame settings).

member.name: M:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.EnvironmentalMapEffect.ApplyMaterial(Ab3d.DirectX.Material,Ab3d.DirectX.RenderablePrimitiveBase)
member.summary: Applies the material and object's world matrix to this effect.

remarks.para: ApplyMaterial applies the material and object's world matrix to this effect.

Usually effects define two constant buffers:
- one that is can be changed only once per frame and contains data about lights,
- one that is different for each material and object.
The first constant buffer is set by calling method.

The second constant buffer can be set by calling method. This sets properties defined in Material. It also sets projection matrixes like world_view_projection and others. The device states (blend state, rasterizer state, etc.) are also set there.

member.param: object that the material is applied for (usually RenderablePrimitive).

member.name: M:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.EnvironmentalMapEffect.PreloadShaders
member.summary: PreloadShaders can be called to load the shaders in advance before they are used. Calling this method increases the startup time, but when the 3D object needs to be shown, it is shown faster because all the shaders have already been created.

member.name: M:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.EnvironmentalMapEffect.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.ModelColorLineEffect
member.summary: ModelColorLineEffect is an effect that is similar to ThickLineEffect but instead rendering lines with fixed and predefined color the line color is based on the color of the model that the line is created for.

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.ModelColorLineEffect.EffectName
member.summary: Effect name

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.ModelColorLineEffect.LineThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the thickness of the line in screen space units.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.ModelColorLineEffect.ReadZBuffer
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean that specifies if Z buffer is read when rendering the line - if the depth test is done when rendering the line. If false then the line is rendered regardless of its depth - if is rendered even if it is behind some other 3D objects.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.ModelColorLineEffect.WriteZBuffer
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean that specifies if Z buffer is written when rendering the line - if the line can occlude other 3D objects. If true then the objects behind the line will not be rendered. If false the line will not prevent rendering objects behind it.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.ModelColorLineEffect.DepthBias
member.summary: Gets or sets a float that specifies a bias that is used when doing a depth test. A bias is a value that is added to the line's depth value and can provide a small offset from another object to prevent Z-fighting that occurs when two objects have almost the same depth values.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.ModelColorLineEffect.DefaultLineColor
member.summary: Color of the line that is used when the color cannot be determined from WPF material

member.name: M:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.ModelColorLineEffect.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.SolidColorEffect
member.summary: SolidColorEffect is an effect that renders the mesh geometry with specified color that is not affected (changed) by the lights in the scene. This effect can also expand the rendered objects in the direction of the normal to create an outline effect.

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.SolidColorEffect.EffectName
member.summary: Effect name

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.SolidColorEffect.OverrideModelColor
member.summary: When true then the is used to render all the 3D models. When false (by default) the color defined in the model's material is used.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.SolidColorEffect.OverrideBlendState
member.summary: When OverrideBlendState is set then SolidColorEffect will use that blend state. When null (by default) then Opaque blend state is used when Alpha is 1, and PremultipliedAlphaBlend is used when Alpha is less then 1 (in this case the color components are also multiplied with alpha value to produce pre-multiplied colors).

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.SolidColorEffect.OverrideRasterizerState
member.summary: When OverrideRasterizerState is set then SolidColorEffect will use this rasterizer state, for example to disable object culling use . When null (by default) then back-face or front-face culling is used based on the geometry and material.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.SolidColorEffect.PremultiplyAlphaColors
member.summary: When PremultiplyAlphaColors is true (by default) and Alpha is less then 1, then the color components are also multiplied with alpha value to produce pre-multiplied colors.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.SolidColorEffect.OutlineThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets a float that specifies the thickness of the outline that is created with expanding the objects in the direction of the normal. The value is specified in screen-space units. Default value is 0 that does not produce any outline.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.SolidColorEffect.DepthBias
member.summary: A DepthBias is a value that specifies how much the line is moved closer to the camera. The value is specified in world coordinates. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.SolidColorEffect.WriteMaxDepthValue
member.summary: When true then the models are rendered to the back of the scene so that all other rendered objects will be rendered before them. This can be used to outline all selected objects without rendering selection lines between them. When false (by default) the models are rendered to their correct depth.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.SolidColorEffect.AddAmbientColor
member.summary: When true then ambient light color is added to the color. False by default.

member.summary: Applies the material and object's world matrix to this effect.

remarks.para: ApplyMaterial applies the material and object's world matrix to this effect.

Usually effects define two constant buffers:
- one that is can be changed only once per frame and contains data about lights,
- one that is different for each material and object.
The first constant buffer is set by calling method.

The second constant buffer can be set by calling method. This sets properties defined in Material. It also sets projection matrices like world_view_projection and others. The device states (blend state, rasterizer state, etc.) are also set there.

member.name: M:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.StandardEffect.GetDirectionalLightShader

member.returns: DirectionalLightShader

member.name: M:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.StandardEffect.ResetRenderableGeometryMaterialFlagsValue
member.summary: When RenderableGeometry objects are rendered in the same order in each frame, the RenderableGeometry.MaterialFlags value specifies how similar the material is to the previous object (for example if diffuse part is the same, then many color checks can be skipped). But when the order of rendering is changed or if we start rendering from the middle of the RenderingQueue, then we need to reset the cached value for the first rendered RenderableGeometry so that all the checks are done again. This method does that.

member.summary: Returns true when per pixel shader should be used for specified shader quality.

member.summary: EffectName

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.ThickLineEffect.UseGeometryShader
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean that specifes if geometry shader is used to render the lines. Note that if DXScene.UseGeometryShaderFor3DLines is set to false, that this will override the value of UseGeometryShader property.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.ThickLineEffect.CustomWireframeRasterizerState
member.summary: Gets or sets a RasterizerState that can be used when 3D lines are drawn without using geometry shader. If not set then DxDevice.CommonStates.WireframeMultisample is used.

remarks.para: CustomWireframeRasterizerState gets or sets a RasterizerState that can be used when 3D lines are drawn without using geometry shader.
If CustomWireframeRasterizerState is null then DxDevice.CommonStates.WireframeMultisample is used.

Using other states from DxDevice.CommonStates has the following effect:
WireframeMultisample - shows all lines antialiased (when showing huge number of lines can be significantly slower then showing non-antialiased lines)
WireframeCullNone - shows all lines without antialiasing
WireframeCullClockwise - hides hidden lines without antialiasing
WireframeCullCounterClockwise - shows only hidden lines without antialiasing
It is also possible to set any custom state to CustomWireframeRasterizerState.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Effects.ThickLineEffect.OverrideBlendState
member.summary: When OverrideBlendState is set then ThickLineEffect will use that blend state. When null (by default) then Opaque blend state is used when lines's alpha color is 1, and NonPremultipliedAlphaBlend is used when alpha color is less then 1.

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.SortedRenderablePrimitiveRenderingQueue
member.summary: RenderablePrimitiveRenderingQueue is derived from RenderingQueue. The difference from RenderingQueue is that RenderablePrimitiveRenderingQueue can accept (with Add method) only objects derived from RenderablePrimitive. This is useful for rendering queues that need to be sorted for example MaterialSortedRenderingQueue and CameraDistanceSortedRenderingQueue.

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.SortedRenderablePrimitiveRenderingQueue.RenderingQueueSorterType
member.summary: RenderingQueueSorterType defines types of sorting that can be used by a RenderingQueue

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.SortedRenderablePrimitiveRenderingQueue.RenderingQueueSorterType.None
member.summary: No sorting is performed - objects are rendering in the same order as they are added to the queue

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.SortedRenderablePrimitiveRenderingQueue.RenderingQueueSorterType.CameraDistance
member.summary: Objects are sorted by camera distance

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.SortedRenderablePrimitiveRenderingQueue.RenderingQueueSorterType.Material
member.summary: Objects are sorted in such a way so that objects with same material are rendered together to reduce the number of needed state changes.

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.SortedRenderablePrimitiveRenderingQueue.RenderingQueueSorterType.Other
member.summary: Objects are sorted by some other criteria.

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.SortedRenderablePrimitiveRenderingQueue.sortedIndexes
member.summary: When sortedIndexes is set, it represents an array of indexes that point to a sorted collection of the renderablePrimitives. This field is used when is set to true.

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.SortedRenderablePrimitiveRenderingQueue.areSortedIndexesValid
member.summary: When true, then the contains a valid indexes of the sorted renderablePrimitives. For performance reasons there are no checks if sortedIndexes are valid so isSortedIndexesValid must be set to true ONLY when sortedIndexes is 100% valid.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.SortedRenderablePrimitiveRenderingQueue.IsSorted
member.summary: Gets a Boolean that specified is rendering queue items have been sorted.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.SortedRenderablePrimitiveRenderingQueue.IsSortingEnabled
member.summary: If true than sortable RenderQueues will be sorted.

member.name: E:Ab3d.DirectX.SortedRenderablePrimitiveRenderingQueue.SortingCompleted
member.summary: RenderingQueueSortingCompleted event is called after this RenderingQueue is sorted. It allows the code in the event handler to change the order in which objects are rendered by changing the values in the provided SortedIndexes array (note: use RenderablePrimitives.Count to get number of items because SortedIndexes.Length may be to big).

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.SortedRenderablePrimitiveRenderingQueue.SortingType
member.summary: Gets a RenderingQueueSorterType that specifies when the RenderingQueue needs to be resorted.

member.summary: Gets a RenderablePrimitiveBase with the specified index
member.param: index of the item in this queue
member.returns: RenderablePrimitiveBase with the specified index

member.summary: Constructor
member.param: boolean that specified is this rendering queue can be rendered with using multiple threads (false by default)
boolean that specified is this rendering queue contains transparent objects or other objects that need to be rendered with alpha blending and where order of rendering is important (false by default)
when not null (by default) then only RenderablePrimitive with this Effect can be added to this rendering queues (usually this is used for MultiThreaded rendering)

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.DXHitTestResult
member.summary: DXHitTestResult is a base class for hit test results in DXEngine.

remarks.para: DXHitTestResult is a base class for hit test results in DXEngine.
The base class defines only field.

The virtual should be overridden by derived classes to provide custom logic when MouseLeave and MouseEnter events should be triggered. By default this happens when the is changed. But when one SceneNode can show multiple objects (for examples with objects instancing), then the custom IsSameObject method can trigger MouseLeave and MouseEnter events in case mouse moves to another part of the SceneNode (another object's instance).

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.DXHitTestResult.HitSceneNode

member.summary: Constructor
member.param: hit SceneNode (can be null when no object was hit)

member.name: M:Ab3d.DirectX.DXHitTestResult.IsSameObject(Ab3d.DirectX.DXHitTestResult)
member.summary: Returns true when the other DXHitTestResult represents the same object. When false is returned then new MouseLeave and MouseEnter events will be triggered.
member.returns: true when the other DXHitTestResult represents the same object

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.ILineRenderingTechnique
member.summary: ILineRenderingTechnique interface is used to override the DXScene line rendering setting.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.ILineRenderingTechnique.UseGeometryShaderFor3DLines
member.summary: When UseGeometryShaderFor3DLines is not null, then this overrides the setting in DXScene object. If set to false and also the is set to false, then the lines are always rendered as 1 pixel thick lines. Note that when using super-sampling the line rendered with that DXAttribute become dimmer because the super-sampled image is still rendered with 1 pixel thick line and that is then down-sampled to final image.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.ILineRenderingTechnique.RenderAntialiased3DLines
member.summary: When RenderAntialiased3DLines is not null, then this overrides the setting in DXScene object. This setting can be used only when is set to false.

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.IPhysicallyBasedMaterial
member.summary: IPhysicallyBasedMaterial interface defines basic values that are used with material for Physically based rendering (PBR material).

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.IPhysicallyBasedMaterial.BaseColor
member.summary: Color4 used for diffuse colors in non-metals ("dielectrics") or specular color in metals. When used with BaseColor texture, this color defines a color mask that is multiplied with each texture value.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.IPhysicallyBasedMaterial.Metalness
member.summary: Float value that specifies the amount of metalness - 0 for non-metal; 1 for raw metal. When used with Metalness texture, this value defines a mask that is multiplied with each texture value.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.IPhysicallyBasedMaterial.Roughness
member.summary: Float value that defines surface irregularities - 0 for totally flat surface; 1 for rough surface without any reflection. When used with Roughness texture, this value defines a mask that is multiplied with each texture value.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.IPhysicallyBasedMaterial.AmbientOcclusionFactor
member.summary: Float value that defines a factor that is multiplied with the ambient occlusion texture (when specified). Default value is 1 which does not change the values in the texture.

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.IVertexScalesMaterial
member.summary: IVertexSizeMaterial interface defines the VertexSizesVertexBufferBinding property that is used to specify vertex buffer that defines scales (as one float value) for each position.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.IVertexScalesMaterial.VertexScalesVertexBufferBinding
member.summary: Gets a VertexBufferBinding for an array of float values where each value represents a scale (or size) of one position.

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.MultiMapMaterial
member.summary: MultiMapMaterial class defines a DXEngine's material that can use multiple texture maps.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.MultiMapMaterial.HasTransparency
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean that specifies if this material is semi-transparent and needs to be alpha blended with the scene.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.MultiMapMaterial.Alpha
member.summary: Gets or sets a float value that defines the alpha value for the material.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.MultiMapMaterial.AmbientColor
member.summary: Gets or sets a Color3 that specifies an color that defines how much ambient color is reflected by this material.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.MultiMapMaterial.DiffuseColor
member.summary: Gets or sets a Color3 that specifies the diffuse color of this material.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.MultiMapMaterial.IsPreMultipliedAlphaColor
member.summary: When IsPreMultipliedAlphaColor is true (false by default) and Alpha is less then 1, then the color components of the are already multiplied with alpha value to produce pre-multiplied colors. When false, then non-pre-multiplied color is converted in pre-multiplied color when this is required by the shader.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.MultiMapMaterial.TextureResourceName
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that can be used to specify the name of the texture - this can be a the file name of the texture file.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.MultiMapMaterial.DiffuseTextures
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of ShaderResourceView that define the textures.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.MultiMapMaterial.SamplerStates
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of SamplerState that define the state of the samplers.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.MultiMapMaterial.TextureBlendState
member.summary: Gets a BlendState that is used to render the texture. If null a CommonStates.Opaque will be used.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.MultiMapMaterial.AlphaClipThreshold
member.summary: Pixels with alpha color values below this value will be clipped (not rendered and their depth will not be written to depth buffer). Expected values are between 0 and 1. When 0 (by default) then alpha clipping is disabled - this means that also pixels with alpha value 0 are fully processed (they are not visible but its depth value is still written so objects that are rendered afterwards and are behind the pixel will not be visible).

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.MultiMapMaterial.HasSpecularColor
member.summary: Gets a boolean that specifies if this material is using specular effect.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.MultiMapMaterial.SpecularColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the Color3 that specifies the color used to draw the specular highlight effect.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.MultiMapMaterial.SpecularPower
member.summary: Gets or sets a float that specifies the power of the specular effect. Zero values means that the specular effect is turned off.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.MultiMapMaterial.EmissiveColor
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean that specifies if this material has only emissive color. If false than other material properties are also defined.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.MultiMapMaterial.HasOnlyEmissiveColor
member.summary: Gets or sets a Color3 that that represents the emissive color - the color of the object regardless of the lights.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.PhysicallyBasedMaterial.BaseColor
member.summary: Color4 used for diffuse colors in non-metals ("dielectrics") or specular color in metals. When used with BaseColor texture, this color defines a color mask that is multiplied with each texture value. Default value is White.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.PhysicallyBasedMaterial.Metalness
member.summary: Float value that specifies the amount of metalness - 0 for non-metal; 1 for raw metal. When used with Metalness texture, this value defines a mask that is multiplied with each texture value. Default value is 1.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.PhysicallyBasedMaterial.Roughness
member.summary: Float value that defines surface irregularities - 0 for totally flat surface; 1 for rough surface without any reflection. When used with Roughness texture, this value defines a mask that is multiplied with each texture value. Default value is 1.

member.summary: Float value that defines a factor that is multiplied with the ambient occlusion texture (when specified). Default value is 1 which does not change the values in the texture. Default value is 1.

member.summary: Gets or sets a Color3 that that represents the emissive color - the color of the object regardless of the lights.

member.summary: Gets a Boolean that specifies if this material has only emissive color. This property is not used in PhysicallyBasedMaterial and always returns false.

member.summary: Gets a boolean that specifies if this material is semi-transparent and needs to be alpha blended with the scene.

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.IPolyLine
member.summary: IPolyLine interface is used by line materials that can define poly lines (connected line segments).

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.IPolyLine.IsPolyLine
member.summary: Gets a Boolean that specifies if the line segments are rendered as polyline with connected segments (when true), or disconnected segments (when false).

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.IPolyLine.MiterLimit
member.summary: Gets a value that defines at which line thickness the mitered (sharp) line joint is converted into beveled (square) line joint. For example, a value of 4 requires the mitered joint length to be 4 times the line thickness before the joint becomes beveled. MiterLimit is used only when IsPolyLine is set to true.

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.IConstantBuffersCache
member.summary: IConstantBuffersCache interface can be implemented by a Material that supports cashing constant buffers.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.IConstantBuffersCache.CachedConstantBuffers
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of DirectX Constant buffers that can be created for this instance of Material. The buffers can be created in Effects and can be reused for multiple frames when the material is not changed.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.IConstantBuffersCache.ConstantBuffersVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets a version that was read from Material's Version at the time of creating the CachedConstantBuffers

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.IHiddenLineMaterial
member.summary: IHiddenLineMaterial interface provides a property that specify if the hidden part of the line will be rendered.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.IHiddenLineMaterial.IsRenderingOnlyHiddenLines
member.summary: Gets a boolean that specifies if line with this material will be rendered when it is in front of other 3D objects (IsRenderingOnlyHiddenLines is false), or when the line is hidden - is behind other 3D objects (IsRenderingOnlyHiddenLines is true)

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.ILinePattern
member.summary: ILinePattern interface can be implemented by a Line material that support line patterns.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.ILinePattern.LinePattern
member.summary: Gets the 16 bit int value that defines the line pattern - if bit is 1 then line is drawn, when 0 line is not drawn. For example value 0xFFFF means full line without any dots or dashes. Value 0x5555 means line with dots - one full dot follows one empty dot.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.ILinePattern.LinePatternScale
member.summary: Gets the pattern scale factor. Value 1 does not scale the pattern. Values bigger then 1 increase the pattern length; values smaller then 1 decrease the pattern length (making it more dense).

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.ILinePattern.LinePatternOffset
member.summary: Gets a pattern offset. This value is usually between 0 and 1 - 0 value means no offset, 1 means offset for the whole patter which is the same as no offset. Value 0.1 means that the line will begin with the pattern advanced by 10%.

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.IPixelMaterial
member.summary: IPixelMaterial interface defines properties that define a pixel material.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.IPixelMaterial.PixelColor
member.summary: Gets the color of the pixels.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.IPixelMaterial.PixelSize
member.summary: Gets the width and height of the pixel in screen space units.

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.ITransparentMaterial
member.summary: ITransparentMaterial interface defines HasTransparency property that specifies if this material need to be rendered with alpha blending enabled.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.ITransparentMaterial.HasTransparency
member.summary: Gets a boolean that specifies if this material is semi-transparent and needs to be alpha blended with the scene.

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.IVertexColorMaterial
member.summary: IVertexColorMaterial interface defines the VertexColorsVertexBufferBinding property that is used to specify vertex buffer that defines colors for each position.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.IVertexColorMaterial.VertexColorsVertexBufferBinding
member.summary: Gets a VertexBufferBinding for an array of Color4 values where each value represents a color of one position.

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.IZBufferStateMaterial
member.summary: IZBufferStateMaterial defines ReadZBuffer and WriteZBuffer properties that control how ZBuffer is used.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.IZBufferStateMaterial.ReadZBuffer
member.summary: Gets a Boolean that specifies if Z buffer is read when rendering the object - if the depth test is done when rendering the object. If false then the object is rendered regardless of its depth - if is rendered even if it is behind some other 3D objects.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.IZBufferStateMaterial.WriteZBuffer
member.summary: Gets a Boolean that specifies if Z buffer is written when rendering the object - if the object can occlude other 3D objects. If true then the objects behind the object will not be rendered. If false the object will not prevent rendering objects behind it.

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.IEnvironmentalMapMaterial
member.summary: IEnvironmentalMapMaterial interface defines properties that define a material that show reflection of the environment defined by the EnvironmentalCubeMap.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.IEnvironmentalMapMaterial.EnvironmentalCubeMap
member.summary: Gets ShaderResourceView that defines the EnvironmentalCubeMap. ShaderResourceView should define a cube map with 6 textures for each side of the cube.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.IEnvironmentalMapMaterial.ReflectionFactor
member.summary: Gets reflection factor from 0 to 1 that is used when is not set (is null). Values 1 means full reflection (only enviromental map will be shown) and 0 means that only diffuse material without environmental map is shown.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.IEnvironmentalMapMaterial.ReflectionMap
member.summary: Gets ShaderResourceView that defines the reflection map where white colors mean fully reflective image and black colors mean no reflection (fully diffuse).

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.PixelMaterial
member.summary: PixelMaterial defines how 3D pixels are drawn with the .

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.PixelMaterial.PixelColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the Color4 of pixels. Default value is White. When array is set, the value of this property is used as a mask that is multiplied with each color defined in the array.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.PixelMaterial.PixelSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the width and height of the pixel in screen space units. This value is scaled with DPI scale factor.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.PixelMaterial.ReadZBuffer
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean that specifies if Z buffer is read when rendering the pixel - if the depth test is done when rendering the pixel. If false then the pixel is rendered regardless of its depth - if is rendered even if it is behind some other 3D objects.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.PixelMaterial.WriteZBuffer
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean that specifies if Z buffer is written when rendering the pixel - if the pixel can occlude other 3D objects. If true then the objects behind the pixel will not be rendered. If false the line will not prevent rendering objects behind it.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.PixelMaterial.CreateDynamicBuffer
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean that specifies if a dynamic vertex buffer will be created from the array. This can be used in case when the colors change very often.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.PixelMaterial.PixelColors
member.summary: Gets or sets a Color4 array that specifies the colors for each pixel. When color's alpha is 0, the pixel is not rendered. When PixelColors array is set, the is used as a mask that is multiplied with each color defined in the array (set PixelColor to White to use the values specified in this array). When null, the color of all the pixels is set by the color defined by the property. When individual values of PixelColors are changed, you need to call method for the changes to take effect.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.PixelMaterial.PixelSizes
member.summary: Gets or sets a float array that specifies the sizes for each pixel. When size is less of equal to 0, the pixel is not rendered. When PixelSizes array is set, the value is multiplied with each size defined in the array (set PixelSize to 1 to use the values specified in this array). When null, the size of all the pixels is set by the value defined by the property. When individual values of PixelSizes are changed, you need to call method for the changes to take effect.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.PixelMaterial.VertexScalesVertexBufferBinding
member.summary: Gets a VertexBufferBinding that is created from array.

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.LineMaterial
member.summary: LineMaterial defines properties that define how 3D lines are drawn.

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.LineMaterial.DefaultMiterLimit
member.summary: Miter limit value that is used when the is explicitly not specified.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.LineMaterial.LineColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the line that is determined from the WpfModel material.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.LineMaterial.LineThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the thickness of the line in screen space units. This value is scaled with DPI scale factor.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.LineMaterial.ReadZBuffer
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean that specifies if Z buffer is read when rendering the line - if the depth test is done when rendering the line. If false then the line is rendered regardless of its depth - if is rendered even if it is behind some other 3D objects.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.LineMaterial.WriteZBuffer
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean that specifies if Z buffer is written when rendering the line - if the line can occlude other 3D objects. If true then the objects behind the line will not be rendered. If false the line will not prevent rendering objects behind it.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.LineMaterial.DepthBias
member.summary: Gets a float that specifies a bias that is used when doing a depth test. A bias is a value that specifies how much the line is moved closer to the camera. The value is specified in world coordinates. When camera is farther away from the object, then a bigger DepthBias is needed.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.LineMaterial.IsPolyLine
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean that specifies if the line segments are rendered as polyline with connected segments (when true), or disconnected segments (when false). Default value is false.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.LineMaterial.MiterLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets a float value that defines at which line thickness the mitered (sharp) line joint is converted into beveled (square) line joint. For example, a value of 4 requires the mitered joint length to be 4 times the line thickness before the joint becomes beveled. MiterLimit is used only when IsPolyLine is set to true. Default value is 2.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.LineMaterial.LinePattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the 16 bit int value that defines the line pattern - if bit is 1 then line is drawn, when 0 line is not drawn. For example value 0xFFFF means full line without any dots or dashes. Value 0x5555 means line with dots - one full dot follows one empty dot. Default value is 0xFFFF which means that no pattern will be drawn.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.LineMaterial.LinePatternScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the pattern scale factor. Value 1 does not scale the pattern. Values bigger then 1 increase the pattern length; values smaller then 1 decrease the pattern length (making it more dense). Default value is 1.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.LineMaterial.LinePatternOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets a pattern offset. This value is usually between 0 and 1 - 0 value means no offset, 1 means offset for the whole patter which is the same as no offset. Value 0.1 means that the line will begin with the pattern advanced by 10%. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.LineMaterial.UseGeometryShaderFor3DLines
member.summary: When UseGeometryShaderFor3DLines is not null, then this overrides the setting in DXScene object. If set to false and also the is set to false, then the lines are always rendered as 1 pixel thick lines. Note that when using super-sampling the line rendered with that DXAttribute become dimmer because the super-sampled image is still rendered with 1 pixel thick line and that is then down-sampled to final image.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.LineMaterial.RenderAntialiased3DLines
member.summary: When RenderAntialiased3DLines is not null, then this overrides the setting in DXScene object. This setting can be used only when is set to false.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.StandardMaterial.HasTransparency
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean that specifies if this material is semi-transparent and needs to be alpha blended with the scene.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.StandardMaterial.Alpha
member.summary: Gets or sets a float value that defines the alpha value for the material.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.StandardMaterial.AmbientColor
member.summary: Gets or sets a Color3 that specifies an color that defines how much ambient color is reflected by this material.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.StandardMaterial.DiffuseColor
member.summary: Gets or sets a Color3 that specifies the diffuse color of this material.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.StandardMaterial.IsPreMultipliedAlphaColor
member.summary: When IsPreMultipliedAlphaColor is true (false by default) and Alpha is less then 1, then the color components of the are already multiplied with alpha value to produce pre-multiplied colors. When false, then non-pre-multiplied color is converted in pre-multiplied color when this is required by the shader.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.StandardMaterial.TextureResourceName
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that can be used to specify the name of the texture - this can be a the file name of the texture file.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.StandardMaterial.DiffuseTextures
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of ShaderResourceView objects that define the textures. Note: setting ShaderResourceView objects to StandardMaterial does not increase reference count on the ShaderResourceView objects. This means that you should not dispose ShaderResourceView objects after they are set to this StandardMaterial.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.StandardMaterial.SamplerStates
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of SamplerState objects that define the state of the samplers. Note: setting SamplerStates objects to StandardMaterial does not increase reference count on the SamplerStates objects. This means that you should not dispose SamplerStates objects after they are set to this StandardMaterial.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.StandardMaterial.TextureBlendState
member.summary: Gets a BlendState that is used to render the texture. If null a CommonStates.Opaque will be used.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.StandardMaterial.AlphaClipThreshold
member.summary: Pixels with alpha color values below this value will be clipped (not rendered and their depth will not be written to depth buffer). Expected values are between 0 and 1. When 0 (by default) then alpha clipping is disabled - this means that also pixels with alpha value 0 are fully processed (they are not visible but its depth value is still written so objects that are rendered afterwards and are behind the pixel will not be visible).

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.StandardMaterial.HasSpecularColor
member.summary: Gets a boolean that specifies if this material is using specular effect.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.StandardMaterial.SpecularColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the Color3 that specifies the color used to draw the specular highlight effect.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.StandardMaterial.SpecularPower
member.summary: Gets or sets a float that specifies the power of the specular effect. Zero values means that the specular effect is turned off.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.StandardMaterial.EmissiveColor
member.summary: Gets or sets a Color3 that that represents the emissive color - the color of the object regardless of the lights.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.Materials.StandardMaterial.HasOnlyEmissiveColor
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean that specifies if this material has only emissive color. If false than other material properties are also defined.

When you do not need to update the color of the texture, then you can also use a static method. User needs to dispose the created OnePixelTexture to prevent resources leaking.

member.summary: DXScene

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXHitTestContext.HitTestParameters
member.summary: Gets the currently used object from the DXScene.

member.name: M:Ab3d.DirectX.DXHitTestContext.#ctor(Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.DXHitTestOptions
member.summary: DXHitTestOptions class specifies hit testing parameters that are used with DXScene's hit testing.

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.DXHitTestOptions.HitTestFilterResult
member.summary: Specifies the return result of a hit test filter callback method.

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.DXHitTestOptions.HitTestFilterResult.Stop
member.summary: Stop hit testing (do not check any other SceneNode)

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.DXHitTestOptions.HitTestFilterResult.Continue
member.summary: Continue hit testing this SceneNode and its child nodes.

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.DXHitTestOptions.HitTestFilterResult.ContinueSkipSelf
member.summary: Continue hit testing the child scene nodes but skip this scene node.

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.DXHitTestOptions.HitTestFilterResult.ContinueSkipChildren
member.summary: Continue hit testing this scene node but skip child scene nodes.

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.DXHitTestOptions.HitTestFilterResult.ContinueSkipSelfAndChildren
member.summary: Continue hit testing but skip this scene node and its child scene nodes (test SceneNodes in other branches).

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.DXHitTestOptions.HitTestFilterCallback
member.summary: When HitTestFilterCallback is specified, the specified predicate is used as a filter that specifies if hit testing is executed on the specified SceneNode and its child SceneNodes (returns true) or not (returns false). When HitTestFilterCallback is null, hit testing is executed on all SceneNodes (as the predicate would always return true).

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXHitTestOptions.UseMultiThreading
member.summary: When true then multi-threaded hit testing algorithms are used when possible.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXHitTestOptions.GetOnlyFrontFacingTriangles
member.summary: When true then only triangles that have normals (calculated from triangle positions) oriented in the opposite direction as the ray are returned (because ray is usually created from the camera's position this returns only triangles that are facing the camera). When false (by default), all hit triangles are returned regardless of their orientation.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXHitTestOptions.GetOnlyOneHitPerSceneNode
member.summary: When true then only one hit result is get from one SceneNode. When false (by default), then multiple hit results can be created by one SceneNode. This property is used only by the method and not by method.

remarks.para: When true then only one hit result is get from one SceneNode.
When false (by default), then multiple hit results can be created by one SceneNode (for example one hit result when ray enters the object and one hit result when ray leaves the object).
This property is used only by the method and not by method.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXHitTestOptions.MeshPositionsCountForOctTreeGeneration
member.summary: Gets or sets an integer value that specifies number of positions in a mesh (DXMeshGeometry3D) at which a OctTree is generated to speed up hit testing (e.g. if mesh has more positions then a value specified with this property, then OctTree will be generated for the mesh). Default value is 512.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXHitTestOptions.GenerateOctTreeOnMeshInitialization
member.summary: When true and when mesh has more positions than , then the OctTree is generated at mesh initialization time. When false and when mesh has more positions than , then the OctTree is generated when first HitTest method is called on the mesh. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXHitTestOptions.OctTreeMaxNodeLevel
member.summary: Number of levels used for OctTree - bigger number reduces the number of triangles in each node but increased the OctTree initialization time and used memory. Default value is 4.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXHitTestOptions.OctTreeExpandChildBoundingBoxes
member.summary: ExpandChildBoundingBoxes is a float that defined how much the bounding boxes of node overlap. By default the value is set to 0.2 - so each bounding box is extended for 20% (but it does not go out of the parent's bounding box). This way the triangles that lay on node borders will be put into the child nodes instead of having them in the parent node (there we need to do a hit test every time).

member.name: M:Ab3d.DirectX.DXHitTestOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Ab3d.DirectX.DXHitTestOptions.Clone
member.summary: Returns a cloned version of this DXHitTestOptions.
member.returns: cloned version of this DXHitTestOptions

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.PostProcessing.GammaCorrectionPostProcess
member.summary:
GammaCorrectionPostProcess is a post process that can apply a custom gamma correction to the rendered image.
The following operation is executed in the shader: finalColor = float4(pow(color.rgb, 1.0 / Gamma), color.a)

member.summary: Gamma value (2.2 by default)

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.PostProcessing.ExpandPostProcess.ExpansionWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the expansion (the distance in pixels that are checked away from the current pixel). ExpansionWidth values can be between 1 (zero is not allowed) and 16 (ExpandPostProcess.MaxExpansionWidth). Bigger numbers mean that more pixels will be sampled in pixel shader and will therefore require more time to execute the post process.

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.PostProcessing.SeparableKernelPostProcess
member.summary: SeparableKernelPostProcess applies horizontal or vertical gaussian post process. It uses array of offsets and weights to define how the pixels are processed (size of the arrays is defined by the filterSize specified in the constructor - max value is 15). This post process usually needs to be rendered in two passes - one vertical and one horizontal.

remarks.para: SeparableKernelPostProcess applies horizontal or vertical gaussian blur post process. It uses array of offsets and weights to define how the pixels are processed.
Offsets define how far from the texture coordinate we sample pixel. Weights define how much weight this pixel has in the final color.
The following pixel shader is used for this post process:

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.PostProcessing.DownSampleWithFilerPostProcess
member.summary: DownSampleWithFilerPostProcess is a post process that can down-sample a bigger texture to a smaller texture. It is using a special slightly rotated pattern (filter) to sample the pixels on a bigger texture in such a way that colors from many pixels are read. This produces better results that simple linear filter that is used in .

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.ResolveBackBufferRenderingStep
member.summary: ResolveBackBufferRenderingStep resolves the multi-sampled back buffer (MSAA) and down-samples the super-samples back buffer (SSAA) into a back buffer without multi-sampling. The source buffer is get from the renderingContext.CurrentBackBuffer. The destination buffer can be customized by calling . When this method is not called, then the renderingContext.FinalBackBuffer is used for destination buffer.

member.summary: Gets or sets the type of down-sampling filter that is used when resolving the super-sampled texture. Default value is . Using a filter results in generally smoother at the cost of a blurrier final result.

member.name: T:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene
member.summary: DXScene is the main object in the DXEngine rendering engine. It defines the 3D scene in a hierarchical tree hat starts with the . It updates the SceneNodes and renders them.

remarks.para:
DXScene has the following tasks in the DXEngine:
- it represents a viewport that shows the scene (has a render target, buffers and other DirectX objects that are used to render the scene to)
- it has the camera
- it holds the hierarchical tree of the 3d objects
- it creates lists of used materials and effects
- it creates list of RenderQueues. Each RenderQueue is filled with IRenderable objects. List of RenderQueues is than passed to DXDevice that renderer the objects to the render targets specified by this DXScene.
- it can get change notifications from 3d objects and updates the lists of materials, effects, and RenderQueues accordingly. It also triggers rendering when needed.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.DXHitTestOptions
member.summary: DXHitTestOptions specifies hit testing parameters that are used with DXScene's hit testing.

member.name: M:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.GetClosestHitObject(SharpDX.Ray,Ab3d.DirectX.SceneNode)
member.summary: GetClosestHitObject method executes a hit testing on the SceneNodes in this DXScene (or when specified on rootSceneNode and its children) and returns a object with the closest triangle hit by the specified ray. When no triangle is hit, null is returned.

remarks.para: HitTest method executes a hit testing on the SceneNodes in this DXScene (or when specified on rootSceneNode and its children) and returns object with the closest triangle hit by the specified ray. When no triangle is hit, null is returned.
It is possible to adjust hit testing with changing the value in the property.
To get all hit results, use the method.

member.param: SharpDX.Ray object that defines the ray that is used for hit testing
SceneNode where the hit testing begins and continues to SceneNode's children. When not set or null, then DXScene.RootNode is used (optional)
member.returns: DXRayHitTestResult with the closest hit object or null if no object was hit

member.name: M:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.GetAllHitObjects(SharpDX.Ray,Ab3d.DirectX.SceneNode)
member.summary: GetAllHitObjects method executes a hit testing on the SceneNodes in this DXScene (or when specified on rootSceneNode and its children) and returns a list of objects sorted from the closest to the farthest object. When no object is hit, an empty list is returned.

remarks.para: GetAllHitObjects method executes a hit testing on the SceneNodes in this DXScene (or when specified on rootSceneNode and its children) and returns a list of objects sorted from the closest to the farthest object. When no triangle is hit, an empty list is returned.
It is possible to adjust hit testing with changing the value in the property.
To get only the closest hit result, use the method.

member.param: SharpDX.Ray object that defines the ray that is used for hit testing
SceneNode where the hit testing begins and continues to SceneNode's children. When not set or null, then DXScene.RootNode is used (optional)
member.returns: a list of DXRayHitTestResult objects or an empty list when no object is hit

member.name: M:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.HitTestSceneNode(SharpDX.Ray,Ab3d.DirectX.SceneNode)
member.summary: Returns DXRayHitTestResult if the specified ray hits the specified sceneNode. Otherwise null is returned. Child SceneNodes are not tested.
member.param: SharpDX.Ray object that defines the ray that is used for hit testing
member.returns: DXRayHitTestResult if the specified ray hits the specified sceneNode. Otherwise null is returned

member.summary: GetHitSceneNodeBounds returns a List of SceneNode objects where the ray intersects the BoundingBox of the SceneNode.
member.param: SharpDX.Ray object that defines the ray that is used for hit testing
SceneNode where the hit testing begins and continues to SceneNode's children. When not set or null, then DXScene.RootNode is used (optional)
member.returns: a List of SceneNode objects where the ray intersects the BoundingBox of the SceneNode

member.name: M:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.TransformRay(SharpDX.Ray@,SharpDX.Matrix@)
member.summary: Transforms the specified ray with the specified matrix. The transformation is done with transforming the ray's position and its direction (direction is transformed without translation).
member.returns: transformed ray

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.Logger
member.summary: Logger is not used in release build and is always null

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.MasterDXScene
member.summary: Gets a DXScene that is set when this DXScene is rendered a 3D scene that is defined in a MasterDXScene.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.HardwareAccelerate3DLines
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean that specifies if rendering 3D lines is hardware accelerated by DXEngine.

remarks.para: HardwareAccelerate3DLines gets or sets a boolean that specifies if rendering 3D lines is hardware accelerated by DXEngine. Default value is true.
When set to false, then 3D lines are rendered by Ab3d.PowerToys or by some other custom engine.

NOTE:
When setting HardwareAccelerate3DLines to false, this must be done before the 3D objects are initialized (after the DXScene was created; when using DXSceneView it is recommended to change the value of this property in DXSceneDeviceCreated event handler). The following examples shows how to do that when using DXViewportView (named MainDXViewportView):

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.RenderConnectedLinesAsDisconnected
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean that specifies if all connected 3D lines (polylines, line arc, rectangle, etc.) are rendered as disconnected 3D lines (separate lines). Default value is false.

remarks.para: RenderConnectedLinesAsDisconnected gets or sets a boolean that specifies if all connected 3D lines (polylines, line arc, rectangle, etc.) are rendered as disconnected 3D lines (separate lines). Default value is false.

Connected 3D lines are 3D lines where the end point of one line is the start point of the next line and where the connection between the lines is "smoothed". In Ab3d.PowerToys library the connected 3D lines are created with the following objects: PolyLineVisual3D, LineArcVisual3D, RectangleVisual3D, MultiPolyLineVisual3D, TextVisual3D, LineWithTextVisual3D, CenteredTextVisual3D.

Disconnected 3D lines are simple 3D lines are not connected to each other. In Ab3d.PowerToys library the connected 3D lines are created with the following objects: LineVisual3D, MultiLineVisual3D, WireBoxVisual3D, WireCrossVisual3D, WireGridVisual3D, WireframeVisual3D.

This property was used before DXEngine v2.3 where connected 3D lines were not hardware accelerated and with using this property connected lines can be rendered as disconnected and hardware accelerated. From this version on, the DXEngine supports full hardware rendering of connected 3D lines and therefore this property can be used only to achieve some special effects.

NOTE:
RenderConnectedLinesAsDisconnected property must be set before the 3D lines are initialized and after the DXScene object is created and. This can be done in the DXSceneDeviceCreated event (here the DXScene and DXDevice are already created).

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.RenderConnectedLinesAsDisconnectedLinesThicknessLimit

remarks.para: RenderConnectedLinesAsDisconnectedLinesThicknessLimit gets or sets the LineThickness value that will limit rendering connected 3D lines (polylines, line arc, rectangle, etc.), as disconnected 3D lines (fully hardware accelerated).
RenderConnectedLinesAsDisconnectedLinesThicknessLimit is not used when is set to true.
Default value is 3 which means that if connected line has LineThickness less or equal to 3, it will be rendered as disconnected 3D line.

Connected 3D lines are 3D lines where the end point of one line is the start point of the next line and where the connection between the lines is "smoothed". In Ab3d.PowerToys library the connected 3D lines are created with the following objects: PolyLineVisual3D, LineArcVisual3D, RectangleVisual3D, MultiPolyLineVisual3D, TextVisual3D, LineWithTextVisual3D, CenteredTextVisual3D.

Disconnected 3D lines are simple 3D lines are not connected to each other. In Ab3d.PowerToys library the connected 3D lines are created with the following objects: LineVisual3D, MultiLineVisual3D, WireBoxVisual3D, WireCrossVisual3D, WireGridVisual3D, WireframeVisual3D.

One simple 3D line can be rendered with rendering a rectangle where rectangle's height would be set to LineThickness and its length to line length. A rectangle can be rendered on the graphics card with creating two triangles. This can be easily done on the graphics card in the geometry shader.

But when connected lines are rendered, this also require to render additional triangle that will smooth the line connections and fill the gap between the lines. This is a moch more complicated operation and is not done on the graphics card. Therefore the MeshGeometry3D for connected lines needs to be prepared on the CPU.

Because the connection triangle that is rendered between two connected lines is hardly visible when LineThickness is less or equal to 3, the DXEngine by default renders all connected lines with LineThickness is less or equal to 3 as disconnected lines. This value can be adjusted by changing the value. Also, setting the property to true will render all connected lines as disconnected.
Note that lines with arrows are never rendered with full hardware accelerated DXEngine.

NOTE:
RenderConnectedLinesAsDisconnectedLinesThicknessLimit and RenderConnectedLinesAsDisconnected properties must be set before the 3D lines are initialized and after the DXScene object is created and. This can be done in the DXSceneDeviceCreated event (here the DXScene and DXDevice are already created).

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.UseGeometryShaderFor3DLines
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean that specifies if 3D lines are rendered with using GeometryShader that can create thick lines. If false, then all 3D lines will be rendered as simple DirectX lines with thickness 1. Default value is true.

remarks.para: UseGeometryShaderFor3DLines gets or sets a boolean that specifies if 3D lines are rendered with using GeometryShader that can create thick lines. If false, then all 3D lines will be rendered as simple DirectX lines with thickness 1. Default value is true.
Setting UseGeometryShaderFor3DLines to false can increase performance when showing many 3D lines.

NOTE
UseGeometryShaderFor3DLines must be set before the 3D objects are initialized (after the DXScene was created; when using DXSceneView it is recommended to change the value of this property in DXSceneDeviceCreated event handler). The following examples shows how to do that when using DXViewportView (named MainDXViewportView):

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.RenderAntialiased3DLines
member.summary: When false and is also false, the 3D lines are rendered without antialiasing them. This greatly improves rendering performance. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.IsAutomaticallyUpdatingBeforeEachRender
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean that specifies if Update method is automatically called before each rendering of the scene (if it was not yet manually called). Default value is true.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.VirtualRealityProvider
member.summary: Gets a virtual reality provider that is currently used by this DXScene. This property can be set by calling method.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.ShadowRenderingProvider
member.summary: Gets a ShadowRenderingProvider that is currently used by this DXScene to render shadows. This property can be set by calling method.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.RenderingQueues
member.summary: RenderingQueues is a read only collection of rendering queues that represent queues of low lever objects that are prepared to be rendered with DirectX. RenderingQueue are rendered in the same order as in the RenderingQueues list. The rendering is done in the rendering step.

remarks.para: RenderingQueues is a read only collection of rendering queues that represent queues of low lever objects that are prepared to be rendered with DirectX.
RenderingQueue are rendered in the same order as in the RenderingQueues list. The rendering is done in the rendering step.
NOTE: A new RenderingQueues instance is created each time a new RenderingQueue is added to removed to this collection. So do not store an instance of this collection locally.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.BackgroundRenderingQueue
member.summary: Gets a RenderingQueue that is rendered first. Objects in this queue are not sorted and are rendered in the same order as they are added to the queue.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.ComplexGeometryRenderingQueue
member.summary: Gets a RenderingQueue that contains opaque and very complex 3D objects that are expected to take a lot of GPU time to render and should therefore start rendering as soon as possible. Usually this queue contains instanced objects, big point cloud objects or standard objects with many triangles. Objects in this queue are not sorted and are rendered in the main thread (no multi-threading rendering) and in the same order as they are added to the queue.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.LineGeometryRenderingQueue
member.summary: Gets a RenderingQueue that contains opaque and single-colored 3D line objects that are rendered with . Objects in this queue are not sorted but are rendered with using multi-threading.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.OtherGeometryRenderingQueue
member.summary: Gets a RenderingQueue that contains opaque objects that cannot be rendered with . Usually this queue contains pixels, objects with physically based rendering material and other objects with non-standard effect (for example vertex colored materials). The objects in this queue are not rendered with using multi-threading. Objects in this queue are sorted so that they are grouped by material to minimize state changes.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.StandardGeometryRenderingQueue
member.summary: Gets a RenderingQueue that contains standard opaque objects that can be rendered with (all objects with or objects that are created from WPF 3D objects). Objects in this queue are sorted so that they are grouped by material to minimize state changes and are also rendered with using multi-threading.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.GeometryRenderingQueue
member.summary: OBSOLETE: GeometryRenderingQueue is obsolete because it was slit into ComplexGeometryRenderingQueue, LineGeometryRenderingQueue, OtherGeometryRenderingQueue and StandardGeometryRenderingQueue. Please add your objects to any of those RenderingQueues. For Backwards compatibility the GeometryRenderingQueue is assigned to the OtherGeometryRenderingQueue.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.ForegroundRenderingQueue
member.summary: Gets a RenderingQueue that is rendered after standard GeometryRenderingQueue but before TransparentRenderingQueue. Objects in this queue are not sorted and are rendered in the same order as they are added to the queue.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.TransparentRenderingQueue
member.summary: Gets a RenderingQueue that contains transparent objects. Objects in this queue are sorted by their distance to the camera - farthest objects are rendered first.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.OverlayRenderingQueue
member.summary: Gets a RenderingQueue that is rendered last. Objects in this queue are not sorted and are rendered in the same order as they are added to the queue.

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.MeshTriangleIndicesCountRequiredForComplexGeometry
member.summary: TriangleIndicesCountRequiredForComplexGeometry specifies the number of triangles that are required to put the objects rendered with WpfGeometryModel3DNode into the ComplexGeometryRenderingQueue (sending it to GPU as fast as possible) instead of into the StandardGeometryRenderingQueue. Default value is 100000.

member.name: F:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.LinesCountRequiredForComplexGeometry
member.summary: LinesCountRequiredForComplexGeometry specifies the number of 3D lines that are required to put the objects rendered with ScreenSpaceLineNode into the ComplexGeometryRenderingQueue (sending it to GPU as fast as possible) instead of into the LineGeometryRenderingQueue. Default value is 20000.

member.name: P:Ab3d.DirectX.DXScene.RenderingSteps
member.summary: Gets a RenderingStepsList that represents the rendering steps that are executed to render the 3D scene.
